jobapplication

Class Application

  • java.lang.Object
    • jobapplication.Application
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Applicable, Available, Eligible

    public class Application
extends java.lang.Object
implements Available
    This class takes the input from the applicant and checks all the conditions and prints the job details.

      Application()
      The no-argument constructor that has no body.

        public Application()
        The no-argument constructor that has no body. Used to instantiate the object.

    • Method Detail

      • fillJobApplicationDetails

        public void fillJobApplicationDetails()
        Method to fill the details of applicant. It should prompt the user to enter the details like firstName, lastName, phoneNumber, workExperience, educationQualification, levelOfCommunication and age.

      • produceTheJobDescriptionForApplicant

        public void produceTheJobDescriptionForApplicant()
        This method produces the job details by checking the conditions. (find detail description in the document).

      • checkQualification

        public boolean checkQualification()
        This method checks the educationQualification of the applicant. It returns true if the educationQualification is either bachelors or masters, otherwise returns false
        Specified by:
        checkQualification in interface Eligible
        Returns:
        a boolean value

      • checkAge

        public boolean checkAge()
        This method checks the age of the applicant. Returns true if the age is greater than 20, false otherwise
        Specified by:
        checkAge in interface Eligible
        Returns:
        a boolean value

      • verifyBackGround

        public java.lang.String verifyBackGround()
        This method verifies the back ground of the applicant by prompting some questions. If the answer to any one of the questions is yes then it returns "You are not eligible to apply", otherwise it returns "You are eligible to apply". (find detail description in the document).
        Specified by:
        verifyBackGround in interface Applicable
        Returns:
        a value of type String

      • haveAGoodBackGround

        public boolean haveAGoodBackGround()
        This method returns true if the output from the verifyBackGround() is "You are eligible to apply", otherwise returns false
        Specified by:
        haveAGoodBackGround in interface Applicable
        Returns:
        a boolean value

      • checkAvailabilityOfJob

        public java.lang.String checkAvailabilityOfJob()
        This method checks the availability of the job by checking the current date with the closingDate of job. It returns a string "The job is still open, you can apply for this job" if the current date is before the closingDate, otherwise it returns a string "The job dead line is closed you cannot apply for it".
        Specified by:
        checkAvailabilityOfJob in interface Available
        Returns:
        a String value

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString method to print the objects of applicant, job, supervisor.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String value
